properties.comment: This configuration describes the names of buttons and menu items in base graphical user interfaces. To change the configuration note that the key is the same as the enum type in BaseFrame.BaseAction and the given value consists of the actual short name and - separated by a semicolon ";" the corresponding tool tip.
properties.entry: Stop the dynamic visualization or abort video generating.

Save the dynamic visualization as a video. Resolution can be adjusted with resolution multiplier in options and the resulting speed of the video itself will be approximately the same as the chosen simulation speed.
Take a screenshot of the whole graph. Resolution can be adjusted with resolution multiplier in options.
Displays the current simulation speed as value. Changeable in Options/Network.
Chose visualization style and data for the dynamic visualization.
Couldn't guess video codec. Given file ending/format correct?
Maximum node size has to be greater than minimum node size. Changing to default values.
Maximum line width has to be greater than minimum line width. Changing to default values.
Attention! Video generation could take some time and high processor workload with the chosen settings ({0}x{1} and {2} pictures).
Error or abort while video encoding. In case of error try again.
In case of dynamic change of node size, this determines the minimum node size.
In case of dynamic change of node size, this determines the maximum node size.
Enable/Disable uniform node colors instead of node colors given in legend.
Sets the color for uniform node color.
Options for the dynamic change of node size.
Options for the dynamic change of node color.
Options for the dynamic change of reactions.
In case of dynamic change of node color, this determines the color for high concentration.
In case of dynamic change of node color, this determines the color for middle concentration.
In case of dynamic change of node color, this determines the color for low concentration.
Determines the minimum line width of dynamic reaction visualization.
Determines the maximum line width of dynamic reaction visualization.
Determines the constant node size in case of dynamic change of node color.
Chose time in miliseconds for how long the current timepoint will be shown.
Chose time in miliseconds for how long the current timepoint will be shown.
Chose time in miliseconds for how long the current timepoint will be shown.
This options determines the play speed.
These settings control the play speed. The smaller the value, the faster the play speed.
This options determines the visualization style.
Chosen data set for visualization is not available by now.
These settings control video encoding and screenshot settings.
Choose how many timepoints are skipped to produce the video. The less timepoints are skipped, the smoother the output video will get.
The higher this multiplier, the better the resolution but the higher the outcoming file size and compution time. It is only used if the output resolution would be too small to generate a sharp video.

By enabling this option, concentration change will be relative. This means each species has its own min/max value with which the changes in visualization are computed, as far as this option is supported by the chosen visualization style.
Enable/disable interpolation of experimental data, if there are less than 100 timepoints.
By enabling this option you can force to use the resolution multiplier even if the video output resolution would be big enough.
Choose if the whole graph should be pictured in videos and screenshots or just the current display window.
